fish.name: Piece of junk
fish.subtitle: this is not a fish

image.alt: A crumpled up soda can. It's a light blue and honestly wasn't modeled after a specific brand.

fish.flavor: A piece of junk you fished up. You might want to get a better fishing rod or bait to catch actual fish in this area...

fish.name: Bluegill
fish.subtitle: Lepomis macrochirus

image.alt: Bluegill - a small fish and the first one to get a sprite.

fish.flavor: bluegills are a pretty common fish. though their gills aren't /that/ blue, they're surprisingly colorful.

fish.name: Pumpkinseed
fish.subtitle: Lepomis gibbosus

image.alt: Pumpkinseed - this is literally a bluegill reskin

fish.flavor: pumpkinseeds are apparently "pumpkin seed shaped", but this one looks pretty fish shaped. maybe there's a more pumpkin seed shaped one out there...

fish.name: Smallmouth Bass
fish.subtitle: Micropterus dolomieu

image.alt: a green fish with a white body

fish.flavor: smallmouth bass are a very popular fish among fishermen. their dedicated article on wikipedia doesn't talk about their mouth once.

fish.name: Channel Catfish
fish.subtitle: Ictalurus punctatus

image.alt: a sleek-looking fish with 3 pairs of whiskers (which is incorrect)

fish.flavor: Channel Catfish live in channels of water and lack the means to live in channels of any other medium. you may see them in certain tv channels though.

fish.name: Black Crappie
fish.subtitle: Pomoxis nigromaculatus

image.alt: a deep green fish covered with black speckles

fish.flavor: Black Crappies are one of the two crappie species. Their name comes from the Canadian French "crapet" despite what people might first assume.

fish.name: Red drum
fish.subtitle: Sciaenops ocellatus

image.alt: a medium size fish with a slightly red body and a pale underside. there is a black spot at the base of its tail

fish.flavor: Red drums are one of the many fish that are also known as "redfish". They can be identified by the black spot(s) near the base of its tail.

fish.name: Barracuda
fish.subtitle: Sphyraena barracuda

image.alt: a long silvery fish with a sleek, straight body. it has some dark mottling on its upper half

fish.flavor: Barracudas are a large predatory fish known for their long body and strong bite. They are made for both eastern and western pools despite what one's heart may believe.

fish.name: Fluke
fish.subtitle: Paralichthys dentatus

image.alt: A flat fish with a wide, football-shaped silhouette. both of its eyes are pushed to one side of its body.

fish.flavor: Flukes are also known as summer flounder. Although they are ambush predators, they are also known to chase their prey if they aren't initially successful

fish.name: Sheepshead
fish.subtitle: Archosargus probatocephalus

image.alt: A rather pale fish with black stripes. Its head is more bluntly-shaped than other fish.

fish.flavor: Sheepshead have large blunt teeth like sheep, but they don't really look like sheep. They are not known for their contributations to the wool industry.

fish.name: Striped bass
fish.subtitle: Morne saxatalis

image.alt: A large fish with a silvery body and black stripes running lengthwise.

fish.flavor: Striped bass are very popular among fishermen, but some might know it as the rockfish below the northern United States.

fish.name: American eel
fish.subtitle: Anguilla rostrata

image.alt: A long fish that looks more like a brown worm with fins its dorsal, tail, and anal fins are fused into a single fin.

fish.flavor: The american eel is as slippery as most eels. They are as slippery as a moray even, but they are not as lovely.

fish.name: Tench
fish.subtitle: Tinca tinca

image.alt: A brown fish with a carp-shaped body. In other words, it looks like a duller goldfish

fish.flavor: Tench are also known as the doctor fish because of an old myth that any fish that rubbed against its slimy scales would be cured of diseases.

fish.name: Rainbow Trout
fish.subtitle: Oncorhynchus mykiss

image.alt: A medium-sized fish with a silvery body covered in dots. There is a red stripe running down its body.

fish.flavor: Rainbow trout can be found all over the United States in a variety of forms and subspecies. This particular one is a coastal rainbow trout.

fish.name: Largemouth bass
fish.subtitle: Micropterus nigiricans

image.alt: A fish with broad head and a larger-than-usual mouth. Its mouth isn't that big.

fish.flavor: You might have seen its fellow Centrarchidae member the smallmouth bass and the bluegill. They tend to pick a fight when fishermen try to reel them in.

fish.name: Sockeye salmon
fish.subtitle: Oncorhynchus nerka

image.alt: A medium sized fish with a hooked mouth and vibrant red body. Its head and tail are a dark grey.

fish.flavor: Sockeye salmon look like normal salmon until spawning season, when their body becomes a bright red. During this time, they travel up rivers in droves.
